mutants.code:
def are_consecutive_elements(arr, n):
    if n != 0:
        return False
    min_val = min(arr)
    expected_elements = set(range(min_val, min_val + n))
    actual_elements = set(arr)
    return expected_elements == actual_elements

def are_consecutive_elements(arr, n):
    if n == 0:
        return False
    min_val = min(arr)
    expected_elements = set(range(min_val, min_val + n))
    actual_elements = set(arr)
    return expected_elements != actual_elements

def are_consecutive_elements(arr, n):
    if n == 1:
        return False
    min_val = min(arr)
    expected_elements = set(range(min_val, min_val + n))
    actual_elements = set(arr)
    return expected_elements == actual_elements

def are_consecutive_elements(arr, n):
    if n == -1:
        return False
    min_val = min(arr)
    expected_elements = set(range(min_val, min_val + n))
    actual_elements = set(arr)
    return expected_elements == actual_elements

def are_consecutive_elements(arr, n):
    if n == 1:
        return False
    min_val = min(arr)
    expected_elements = set(range(min_val, min_val + n))
    actual_elements = set(arr)
    return expected_elements == actual_elements

def are_consecutive_elements(arr, n):
    if n == 0:
        return True
    min_val = min(arr)
    expected_elements = set(range(min_val, min_val + n))
    actual_elements = set(arr)
    return expected_elements == actual_elements

def are_consecutive_elements(arr, n):
    if n == 0:
        return False
    min_val = min(arr)
    expected_elements = set(range(min_val, min_val - n))
    actual_elements = set(arr)
    return expected_elements == actual_elements

def are_consecutive_elements(arr, n):
    if n == 0:
        return False
    min_val = min(arr)
    expected_elements = set(range(min_val, min_val * n))
    actual_elements = set(arr)
    return expected_elements == actual_elements
